trans-unit.source: How to harden your services against Graceful/Ungraceful failures
trans-unit.target: How to harden your services against Graceful/Ungraceful failures

trans-unit.source: The scenarios shipping with Testability enable developers to not worry about dealing with individual faults.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios shipping with Testability enable developers to not worry about dealing with individual faults.

trans-unit.source: There are scenarios however, where an explicit interleaving of client workload and failures might be needed.
trans-unit.target: There are scenarios however, where an explicit interleaving of client workload and failures might be needed.

trans-unit.source: The interleaving of client workload and faults, ensures that the service is actually performing some action when failure happens.
trans-unit.target: The interleaving of client workload and faults, ensures that the service is actually performing some action when failure happens.

trans-unit.source: Given the level of control testability provides these could be at precise points of the workload execution.
trans-unit.target: Given the level of control testability provides these could be at precise points of the workload execution.

trans-unit.source: This induction of faults at different states in the application can find bugs and improve quality.
trans-unit.target: This induction of faults at different states in the application can find bugs and improve quality.

trans-unit.source: This test shows a scenario where the interleaving of business workload with <linkText>graceful and ungraceful failures</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This test shows a scenario where the interleaving of business workload with <linkText>graceful and ungraceful failures</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The faults should be induced while in the middle of service operations or compute for best results.
trans-unit.target: The faults should be induced while in the middle of service operations or compute for best results.

trans-unit.source: Lets walk through an example of a serice that exposes four workloads A, B, C and D. Each corresponds to a set of workflows and could be compute, storage or a mix.
trans-unit.target: Lets walk through an example of a serice that exposes four workloads A, B, C and D. Each corresponds to a set of workflows and could be compute, storage or a mix.

trans-unit.source: For the sake of simplicity we will abstract out the workloads in our example.
trans-unit.target: For the sake of simplicity we will abstract out the workloads in our example.

trans-unit.source: The different faults executed in this example are.
trans-unit.target: The different faults executed in this example are.

trans-unit.source: RestartNode: Ungraceful fault to simulate a machine restart
trans-unit.target: RestartNode: Ungraceful fault to simulate a machine restart

trans-unit.source: RestartDeployedCodePackage: Ungraceful fault to simulate service host process crashes
trans-unit.target: RestartDeployedCodePackage: Ungraceful fault to simulate service host process crashes

trans-unit.source: RemoveReplica: Graceful fault to simulate replica removal
trans-unit.target: RemoveReplica: Graceful fault to simulate replica removal

trans-unit.source: MovePrimary: Graceful fault to simulate replica moves triggered by Service Fabric Load Balancer
trans-unit.target: MovePrimary: Graceful fault to simulate replica moves triggered by Service Fabric Load Balancer
